intro: Galipea pentagyna, commonly known as the five-angled galipea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with five petals. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains several seeds.
